meanings.definition: The condition of having more than the normal number of fingers or toes.
meanings.sent1: Polydactyly can result in a person having six fingers on one hand.
meanings.sent2: The baby was born with polydactyly, having an extra toe on each foot.
meanings.sent3: At the circus, the clown joked that his polydactyly made it easier to juggle.
meanings.sent4: Her polydactyly was like having a bonus feature on her hands.
meanings.sent5: Polydactyly stood out in the family portrait, with some members having extra fingers.

meanings.definition: A congenital physical anomaly characterized by supernumerary digits.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that polydactyly is when a person is born with extra fingers or toes.
meanings.sent2: Polydactyly is a rare condition where someone may have more than five fingers on a hand.
meanings.sent3: The polydactyly in the painting gave the portrait an intriguing twist.
meanings.sent4: In a world of limitations, polydactyly can be seen as a unique advantage.
meanings.sent5: The polydactyly in the family tree surprised everyone, showing up unexpectedly in each generation.
